Shennat dissertation: Dimensional analysis of Lucid programs

stories.text:
Let us ignore management roles. Let us also assume equal soft skills and equivalent expertise (meaning, a wordpress developer is as good at wordpress as a GoLang developer is at Golang). Same for domain knowledge.

Given everything else is equal, what tech skill would you pick to earn the maximum? Both as a freelancer and as a full time employee?

In other words, what skill has paid you the most?

I am asking because I am sick of being poor and of doing the same CRUD apps over and over again. I am experimenting with a few skillsets to pick from - being interested in the skillset is obviously the first item on the list, closely followed by the pay.
stories.title: Ask HN: Which tech skill would you pick, if your goal is to maximize earnings?

stories.text:
Both Thunderbird (w/ TbSync) and Evolution work fine for basic calendar stuff.

However, when comparing to Apple Calendar, they seem to lack two crucial features: - calendar delegation (sharing with other users) - meeting invitation; the events do show, but I can't way to change one's attendance status

It seems to me that at least one software capable of doing this should exist. Am I missing something? Is CalDav just a broken protocol whose full implementation is doomed to remain just a sweet dream?
stories.title: Ask HN: GNU/Linux calendar software handling CalDav delegation and invitation?
We've never even built datacenters using robots here on Earth
